div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 235 Jannina environs, Epirus, 1935 (511) Burial: c. 168 B.C. Contents: c. 70 AR Philip V: 1 didr. Perseus: c. 52 tetradr.; 1 didr. Epirote Rep.: 17 AR (incl. 1 dr., 4 vict., 1 1/2-vict.) Disposition: New York 2 (1 ex Berry, SNG 382); O. Ravel 5; priv. coll. Athens 2) Franke, JNG 1957, pp. 34-5, 47-9, illus. and supplementary information The ANS has 2 Perseus tetradr. from the hd. The Perseus didr. (published by Franke, no. 2) was acquired in 1956 and has no certain connection with the find. A photo of the Ravel piece cited by Franke is on file in the ANS
